member.name: IAMTimecodeGenerator.GetTCGMode

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetTCGMode method retrieves the SMPTE timecode generator properties.

param.name: Param
param.para: Timecode generator mode. Specify one of the following modes you want to get settings for.

listheader.description: Source of the hardware clock reference
SMPTE timecode format of the generator

param.name: pValue
param.para: Pointer to the current setting of the mode specified in Param.
If you specify ED_TCG_FRAMERATE in Param, this parameter retrieves one of the following.

listheader.description: 30 frames per second. Drop frame (actually 29.97 fps).

param.para: If you specify ED_TCG_REFERENCE_SOURCE in Param, this parameter retrieves one of the following.
If you specify ED_TCG_SYNC_SOURCE in Param, this parameter retrieves one of the following.
If you specify ED_TCG_TIMECODE_TYPE in Param, this parameter retrieves one of the following.

member.returns: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

member.name: IAMTimecodeGenerator.GetTimecode

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The GetTimecode method retrieves the most recent timecode and/or userbit value available in the stream.

member.returns: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

member.name: IAMTimecodeGenerator.get_VITCLine

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The get_VITCLine method retrieves which line(s) the vertical interval timecode information has been inserted into.

member.param: Pointer to the vertical line(s) containing the timecode information (valid lines are 11-20).
member.returns: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

member.name: IAMTimecodeGenerator.put_VITCLine

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The put_VITCLine method specifies which line to insert the vertical interval timecode information into.

member.param: Vertical line to contain the timecode information (valid lines are 11-20; 0 means autoselect).
member.returns: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

member.name: IAMTimecodeGenerator.SetTCGMode

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetTCGMode method sets the SMPTE timecode generator properties.

param.name: Param
param.para: Timecode generator mode. Specify one of the following modes.

listheader.description: Source of the hardware clock reference
SMPTE timecode format of the generator

param.name: Value
param.para: Setting of the mode specified in Param.
If ED_TCG_FRAMERATE is specified in Param, this parameter is set to one of the following.

listheader.description: 30 frames per second. Drop frame (actually 29.97 frames per second).

param.para: If ED_TCG_REFERENCE_SOURCE is specified in Param, set one of the following.
If ED_TCG_SYNC_SOURCE is specified in Param, set one of the following.
If ED_TCG_TIMECODE_TYPE is specified in Param, set one of the following.

member.returns: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

member.name: IAMTimecodeGenerator.SetTimecode

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The SetTimecode method sets the timecode, userbit value, or both.

member.returns: Returns an HRESULT value that depends on the implementation of the interface.

summary.para: [The feature associated with this page, DirectShow, is a legacy feature. It has been superseded by MediaPlayer and . MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine have been optimized for Windows 10 and Windows 11. Microsoft strongly recommends that new code use MediaPlayer and IMFMediaEngine instead of DirectShow, when possible. Microsoft suggests that existing code that uses the legacy APIs be rewritten to use the new APIs if possible.]
The IAMTimecodeGenerator interface controls how an external SMPTE/MIDI timecode generator supplies data to the filter graph.

DirectShow currently does not provide any filters that implement this interface. Third parties should implement this interface on any filter that controls an external timecode generator. Timecode generators can be built into a VCR or can be separate external devices. The device must be able to read timecode and send it to the computer over its control interface. If not, the user must have a timecode reader card in the computer, or you can write a software decoder that converts VITC embedded in captured video frames or LTC captured as an audio signal into DirectShow timecode samples.

SMPTE timecode is a frame addressing system that identifies video and audio sources, makes automatic track synchronization possible, and provides a container for additional data related to the production. SMPTE timecode's main purpose is to provide a machine-readable address for video and audio. It is displayed in hh:mm:ss:ff format and is thoroughly defined in ANSI/SMPTE 12-1986.
Optionally, you can enable applications to convert timecode to reference time by supporting the method on the filter.
For hardware requirements, see the interface.
